title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દાખું દાસ દંઢાવ્યના, ભક્ત અતિ ઘણું ભાવિક<RHYME_206499>; 
દ્રઢ મતિ ધીરજ્ય અતિ, જાણે સત્ય અસત્ય વિવેક<RHYME_206499>.
gujarati.context: A true devotee is one who deeply understands the mysteries of life and can distinguish between truth and falsehood, being both steadfast and wise.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
તન મન ધન તુચ્છ કરી, હરિજન થયાં નરનાર્ય<RHYME_206500>; 
પ્રકટ પુરુષોત્તમને, મળી ઊતર્યાં ભવપાર્ય<RHYME_206500>.
gujarati.context: A person's mind and wealth are destroyed when they're consumed by pride; only the humble can be considered noble.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
બાલ જોબન વૃદ્ધ વળી, સરવે થયાં સનાથ<RHYME_206501>; 
પરાપાર પરબ્રહ્મ જે, તેહ નીરખ્યા નયણે નાથ<RHYME_206501>.
gujarati.context: A person's youth is like a tree that grows strong and tall, while their old age is like the fruit that falls from it. One should see the impermanence of life in both the growth and decay.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એવાં જન અનઘનાં, લેતાં નામ આવે આનંદ; 
શ્રવણ દઈ જે સાંભળે, તે વામે મહાદુઃખ દ્વન્દ્વ.
gujarati.context: People who are not pained by suffering, take the name of joy; but those who listen to it with a broken heart will suffer great sorrow twice.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
મોટા ભક્ત છે મોટેરે ગામ<RHYME_206502>, કણબી ભક્ત ભૂધરદાસ નામ<RHYME_206502>; 
પુરુષોત્તમ રઘો નાથજી, હાંસજી વેણીદાસ રામજી.
gujarati.context: A great devotee is one from a big village, named Bhudhardas; Purushottam Raghuvanshi is the name of the blessed one who sings with joy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
લખો લખુ ભગો પ્રભુદાસ, બાઈ કુંક્યે ત્યાગી જગઆશ; 
બાઈ હરિ ને રળિયાત બાઈ, રતનબાઈ છે મોટેરા માંઇ.
gujarati.context: Lord Prabhu Das, write as you please, for I have let go of worldly desires. My soulmate is Hari's love, and we are one in the eternal world.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જેઠો ભક્ત જન ગંગાબાઈ, કણબી ભક્ત કોટેશ્વર માંઇ; 
અડાલજ માંહિ છે ચોધરી, તજી કુળધરમ ભજ્યા હરિ.
gujarati.context: The devout person worships Ganga Bai and the one who is devoted to Koteswar Mahadev; there is no doubt that his family lineage will be blessed by God.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત જેરામ ને લાલ<RHYME_206504>, જેઠો અવિચળ પુરજમાલ<RHYME_206504>; 
કણબી હરખજી પુંજો ભાટ<RHYME_206505>, રહે ઉમારસદે તજી ઉચ્ચાટ<RHYME_206505>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

A true devotee's love is like a red lotus, pure and untainted; they remain elevated in their faith and joy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દેવજાતિ તે ભક્ત છે આશો, કહીએ એહનો કલોલે વાસો; 
કણબી ભક્ત ગંગાદાસ કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, નરોત્તમ વાસણજી લહીએ<RHYME_206507>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization:

The devotee is filled with longing for the divine, and their soul's cry is heard by God; similarly, Bhakt Gangaadas says that Vasnaji is the ultimate truth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત કાકુજી ને કાશીદાસ<RHYME_206508>, શીધરદાસનો ઓલામાં વાસ<RHYME_206508>; 
રૂડાં ભક્ત છે બાઈ રતન<RHYME_206509>, એહ રહે ઓલે હરિજન<RHYME_206509>.
gujarati.context: The devotee is like Kashidasa and Shiddharadas, humble and devoted; True devotees are like the lotus plant, rooted in God and unaffected by worldly taints.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત સુતાર જેઠો કેશવજી, કણબી કાશીદાસ ને રાયજી; 
દ્વિજ ભવાનીશંકર ભાઈ, શા ઝવેર ધમાસણા માંઇ.
gujarati.context: The devotee is blessed by Keshavji, just as Kashidas was favored by Rayaji; the dualistic nature of Bhavanishankar's brother is in vain, like a desert with no water.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત કોળી વાલો કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, જન ગામ જલોદમાં લહીએ<RHYME_206507>; 
ખાંટ ભક્ત બાદરજી જેહ<RHYME_206511>, રતુજી અરજણજી તેહ<RHYME_206511>.
gujarati.context: The devotees of God say that the people of Gujarat are like a flame that burns in Jalod; those who have faith in God are like the autumn season, which is brief and fleeting.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત છે હવનબાઈ<RHYME_206512>, એહાદિ જન આદ્રેજ માંઈ<RHYME_206512>; 
જીવી રતન ને પ્રભુદાસ<RHYME_206508>, કણબી ભક્ત કોલવડે વાસ<RHYME_206508>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee (Hari Bhakt) is blessed with divine love, and the Lord's grace is bestowed upon them. The true believer (Prahu Das) lives in devotion to God, their heart filled with faith and joy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત રામદાસ ભાઈ<RHYME_206513>, કુબેર વસન નાની બાઈ<RHYME_206513>; 
કણબી ભક્ત કહીએ મોટીબાઈ<RHYME_206513>, ભક્ત ભાટ રઘો બાજીભાઈ<RHYME_206513>.
gujarati.context: Ramdas, a devoted devotee, compares his beloved to Kubera's wife, Nani Bai, suggesting great devotion. He also calls her Mota Bai, implying even greater devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ રૂપ રળિયાત નામ<RHYME_206502>, ઠાર હરખો ઉનાવે ગામ<RHYME_206502>; 
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત રાસોજી વખતો, ભજવા હરિ કર્યો દ્રઢ મતો.
gujarati.context: The Lord's divine form is named "Dwij" and is revered in the village of Unava; The devotee's heart is steadfastly fixed on God, even during times of turmoil.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન ગલાલ સોનાર<RHYME_206515>, દ્વિજ દોલી રાઈ ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>; 
એહ આદિ ભક્ત બીજા કંઈ<RHYME_206516>, ભજે પ્રભુ પેથાપર રઈ<RHYME_206516>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The lowly are elevated to divine status, and the pious receive their due reward; one who adores God with devotion will be granted spiritual growth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ઇચ્છો સકરો કસલો વળી, એહ આદિ જન જણસાલિ; 
ભક્ત એક છે મીઠો કુંભાર<RHYME_206517>, વસે વાસણગામ મોઝાર<RHYME_206517>.
gujarati.context: The couplet emphasizes the importance of having a clear intention and focus (ઇચ્છો) to achieve one's goals, and being mindful of one's words and actions (આદિ જન).
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
અમજે ભક્ત મૂલો ચોધરી, ભજી હરિ ગયો ભવ તરી; 
પગી લાલો છેલો હરિજન<RHYME_206509>, શોભાસણામાં ભક્ત પાવન<RHYME_206509>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a devotee who has realized the true nature of God, having crossed the worldly ocean; and now remains in awe, being a lowly servant of God in the realm of beauty.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત કુબેર ખુશાલ<RHYME_206519>, ચાંદિસણે એ ભક્ત વિશાલ<RHYME_206519>; 
કણબી દેવજી રહે ગામ સોજે, ભજે પ્રભુજીને સુખ મોજે.
gujarati.context: A devout soul finds solace in Kubera's wealth, and their faith grows boundless; the divine dweller resides peacefully in the village, rejoicing in praising the Lord with contentment.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ઈટાદરે કણબી ગણેશ<RHYME_206521>, કરે ભજન હરિનું હમેશ<RHYME_206521>; 
ભક્ત સુતાર બેચર નામ<RHYME_206502>, હરિજન કહીએ ગંગારામ<RHYME_206502>.
gujarati.context: Ganesh's laughter brings joy and devotion to God's name; devotees like Gangaram are blessed with spiritual growth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ અંબારામ દુલભરામ<RHYME_206502>, શેઠ ભક્ત સાંકળા બે નામ<RHYME_206502>; 
પીતાંબર બેચર ઝૂમખો, ભાઈચંદાદિ ભાવસાર લખો.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The author has two names, Dulbharam and Sheth Bhakt, just like the dual forms of the Ganges River; and like the pious and bereaved, he writes with a longing for his brother Chandadi.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત ગણેશ ને ભગો, તેલી મૂલચંદે મેલ્યો દગો; 
ધનો દલોદાસ છે ચોધરી, મેલી પાપ ભજ્યા આપે હરિ.
gujarati.context: A devotee who is consumed by devotion to Ganesha gets entangled in the web of materialistic desires; only a true servant of God can free themselves from the cycle of sin and suffering.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી હિંદુજી છે હરિજન<RHYME_206509>, એહ આદિ પુરુષ પાવન<RHYME_206509>; 
દ્વિજ કુશલ સોનાં ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>, એહ બાઇયો માણસા મોઝાર<RHYME_206515>.
gujarati.context: The Hindu is a warrior and a servant of God; he should be noble-minded and not covetous.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત વીરો જીવણ ચોધરી, રાઠોડ વણારશી ભજે હરિ; 
ક્ષત્રી રવોજી વોરો મિયાંજી, વસે વરસોડે કુસંગ તજી.
gujarati.context:
Devotees, like brave warriors, sing the praise of God; 
While earthly battles end with each passing year, spiritual turmoil subsides.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત કિકો ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>, રહે લાખરોડ ગામ મોઝાર<RHYME_206515>; 
કણબી ભક્ત ગોવિંદજી નામે, જન વસે વિજાપર ગામે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotees of God, with hearts full of love and devotion, live in harmony in their village. They are known for their good deeds and virtuous nature, earning them respect and admiration from others.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જણસાલિ લખા ધના, રહે રાણાસર ભક્ત પ્રભુના; 
હરિજન પ્રાગજી લુવાર<RHYME_206515>, ભક્ત રહે સિંઘપર મોઝાર<RHYME_206515>.
gujarati.context: The devout worshiper of the Lord resides in the land of Rana and Dhana, a place of great devotion. Similarly, the lowly Harijan is elevated to the heights of Pragji Luvra and Bhakt remains in the majestic Singhpur Mozhar.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત દયાળજી જન<RHYME_206509>, જેણે બહુ જીવ કર્યા પાવન<RHYME_206509>; 
સતવારા પ્રાગજી ને જીવો, રેવો સાંકળો ને ભક્ત દેવો.
gujarati.context: A devoted devotee's mercy is abundant, as they have lived many lives with peace. Their prayers are heard by the Supreme Being, and their worries are like threads in a rosary that the Lord takes care of.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન વજીબાઈ એક<RHYME_206527>, જેઠી વખત વજી વણિક<RHYME_206527>; 
નંદબાઈ રળિયાતબાઈ, એહાદિ જન વિજાપર માંઇ.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

One low-caste woman, Vajibai, was so kind; she would give her entire wealth to anyone in need.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત દ્વિજ પીતાંબર<RHYME_206528>, કહું કણબી ભક્ત સુંદર<RHYME_206528>; 
કુબેર તુલસી ને રામજી, જીવણ નરસૈ શંકર શામજી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet in 1-2 lines:

The devotee Pitaambar, I say, is a beautiful one; and Kubera, Rama's friend, worships Tulsi with Shankar as witness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કલ્યાણ જન રતનબાઈ, ભક્ત એક કણબી કુળ માંઇ; 
હેમચંદ રામચંદ જન<RHYME_206509>, ભાવસાર એ ભક્ત પાવન<RHYME_206509>.
gujarati.context: The devoted soul, Ratnabai, is blessed with a noble family lineage; her devotion to God is like a beacon shining brightly.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન છે જગો સુતાર<RHYME_206515>, દ્વિજ માનું વિહાર મોઝાર<RHYME_206515>; 
આશારામ મોતી ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>, શા અંબારામ ભક્ત ઉદાર<RHYME_206515>.
gujarati.context: The lowly Harijan is considered worthy of the world's praise, and one who takes up their rightful place in society; their devotion to God is truly selfless and generous.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત તારાચંદ નંદરામ<RHYME_206502>, ભાવસાર માનું સાંકલિ નામ<RHYME_206502>; 
કણબી ભક્ત હરિભાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત જલોભાઈ લહીએ<RHYME_206507>.
gujarati.context: The devotee's name is Chandram, and his soul is surrendered to the Lord. The true devotees of God are those who have sacrificed their material desires and worldly attachments.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત દ્વિજ હુલાસ છે એક<RHYME_206527>, ભજી હરિ તજી નહિ ટેક<RHYME_206527>; 
એહ આદિ હરિજન જેહ<RHYME_206511>, વસે ગામ ગેરિતામાં તેહ<RHYME_206511>.
gujarati.context: A devotee is one who is always eager and never tired of worshipping God, just like a farmer tilling the land without pause. Such is the nature of a true believer who cultivates devotion in their heart.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન દેવો સતવારો, ગામ ગવાડે ભક્ત એ સારો; 
દ્વિજ ધનજી ને રામબાઈ, ભક્ત પ્રભુના પામોલ્ય માંઇ.
gujarati.context: The humble and devoted Harijan (outcaste) is considered divine, while the rich and powerful are often corrupted in their community. Even Dvijendra, a man of great wealth, was humbled by his devotion to Ramabai, a true devotee of God.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત વણારશી રાયચંદ<RHYME_206530>, ભજે ભાવસાર એ ગોવિંદ<RHYME_206530>; 
હરિજન એક લખિરામ<RHYME_206502>, એહ જન આગલોડ્ય ગામ<RHYME_206502>.
gujarati.context: The devout servant of God, Bhakt Vanareshwarai Raychand, worships the Lord with pure devotion; he is a Harijan (outcaste) who has gained spiritual wealth through his faith.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ મનછારામ હરિજન<RHYME_206509>, રહે કડા ગામમાં પાવન<RHYME_206509>; 
ક્ષત્રી નારુજી રતુજી નામ<RHYME_206502>, ગાંગજી ને દ્વિજ શિવરામ<RHYME_206502>.
gujarati.context: A lowly man is considered pure by God, and resides in a small village, which is pleasing to Him. His name is Ratujii, a noble title given to him, just like Ganges River is called Dwij Shivaram.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
અંબારામ સોની પ્રેમચંદ<RHYME_206530>, એ બામણવે ભજે ગોવિંદ<RHYME_206530>; 
કોળી ભક્ત જોયતો કુબોજી, રહે છાબલિયે હરિ ભજી.
gujarati.context: A devotee's love for God is like a precious gem, and a true believer will worship the Lord with devotion. Even a simpleton can achieve salvation if they worship God with sincerity.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત ભાટ સાયબોજી જાણો, ગામ કૈપરમાં પરમાણો; 
વડનગરે વસે બહુ જન<RHYME_206509>, ભક્ત પ્રભુના પરમ પાવન<RHYME_206509>.
gujarati.context: The faithful know that the world is a mere plaything, and true abundance can be found only in one's hometown; many dwell in the city of God, under the divine protector.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ઉજમ મુગટરામ<RHYME_206502>, સદાશિવ વનમાળી નામ<RHYME_206502>; 
બેચરાદિ દ્વિજ ભક્ત ભાઈ<RHYME_206513>, હરિજન જેઠી દોલિબાઈ<RHYME_206513>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The lord's name is "Mugtarum" and he is eternal, while his devotee brother Dolibai is a Harin (untouchable) caste person.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ફૂલા ઝૂમખા આદિ અપાર<RHYME_206515>, ભલા ભક્ત કહીએ ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>; 
ઊગરચંદ હેમચંદ દોય<RHYME_206533>, વસે વડનગરે જન સોય<RHYME_206533>.
gujarati.context:
The beauty of flowers and the joy of devotion are boundless; the true devotee's heart is filled with love and reverence.

In the mortal world, the soul wanders aimlessly until it finds its true home.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સોની ભક્ત દયારામભાઈ<RHYME_206534>, ખીમો ગોવિંદજી દલુભાઈ<RHYME_206513>; 
એહ આદિ બીજાં હરિજન<RHYME_206509>, વસે શ્રીપોરે ભક્ત પાવન<RHYME_206509>.
gujarati.context: The devotees of the Golden God, Daryarambhai and Govindji Dalubhai, have attained the sacred place of Sri Por where they now reside in devotion to the Lord.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વડા ભક્ત છે વિશનગરે, શીશ સાટાની ભક્તિ કરે; 
દ્વિજ સૂર્યરામ મોતીરામ<RHYME_206502>, બળદેવ કૃષ્ણાધર નામ<RHYME_206502>.
gujarati.context: The devout person is like a mountain peak, steadfast in their devotion; the Lord Rama and Krishna are my guides and protectors.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
અમુલખ આદિ દ્વિજભાઈ<RHYME_206536>, ઉદેકુંવર્ય લક્ષ્મીબાઈ<RHYME_206513>; 
શિવબાઈ ને ઊજળી એક<RHYME_206527>, ભજ્યા હરિ તે કરી વિવેક<RHYME_206527>.
gujarati.context: Two sisters, Mulakh and Laxmibai, are devoted to their brother Shiva, while a devotee's humility is the key to spiritual growth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
શા જેચંદ પુંજો દયારામ<RHYME_206537>, સોની પીતાંબર અંબારામ<RHYME_206537>; 
હરિજન છે લાડકુંવરી, કણબી રામજી તુલસી હરિ.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a lotus flower blooming in muddy waters, yet remaining untainted and pure, just like a devotee's love for God remains unsoiled by worldly attachments.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સતસંગી શિલાટ સુંદર<RHYME_206528>, જેઠારામ ને નામ બેચર<RHYME_206528>; 
ત્રિભોવન ને અમરચંદ<RHYME_206530>, હેમચંદાદિ ભજે ગોવિંદ<RHYME_206530>.
gujarati.context: A virtuous friend is a beautiful gem, named after Jetharam; the threefold bliss (body, mind, and spirit) is worshiped as God through Hemchand's Amar Chand.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત વનમાળી ને ઊગરો, પાનાચંદ ને વારુ ઝવેરો; 
એહ આદિ ભક્ત ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>, વસે વિશનગર મોઝાર<RHYME_206515>.
gujarati.context: The devotee is busy with worldly affairs, while the pan and chanda (alms) are crying out for attention; this is the state of the seeker's inner turmoil.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત મીઠો ને નાગજી, ગામ જાગીરે રહે હરિ ભજી; 
જેઠો પ્રેમજી ને હંસરાજ<RHYME_206539>, કણબી ભક્ત જાણો જશરાજ<RHYME_206539>.
gujarati.context: The devoted soul is filled with divine joy and wakes up the village of Hari Bhajan; one who has obtained royal love knows the secrets of true devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દેવબાઈ નંદબાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, ગામ આઇઠોરમાં એ લહીએ<RHYME_206507>; 
કણબી ભક્ત છે ખુશાલભાઈ, ભજે હરિ રહે ઉપેરા માંઇ.
gujarati.context: The couplet is saying that one should be devoted to God, just like the river Narmada flows continuously in the land of Gujarat.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ઊંઝે કણબી ભક્ત નારાયણ<RHYME_206540>, શામો વાલો પ્રભુપરાયણ<RHYME_206540>; 
મોરાર મૂલજી કામરાજ<RHYME_206541>, કર્યું ગણેશ ખુશાલે કાજ<RHYME_206541>.
gujarati.context: The devotee, Naraayan, is elevated by Lord Prabhu's grace; his karma is cleansed through the blessings of Ganesha.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ નાથો જેકુંવર્યબાઈ, એહ આદિ ભક્ત ઊંઝા માંઇ; 
સિતપુરમાં બાઈ ચતુરી, ભાવસાર છે ભાવની પૂરી.
gujarati.context: In the divine court, a devotee's heart is filled with love and devotion; in Sitapur, a woman's soul is complete with spiritual longing.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ચોપદાર ભગવાનભાઈ, રહ્યો સુખે સિતપુર માંઇ; 
ભક્ત ભાવસાર દયાળજી, પુરુષોત્તમને ભક્તિ રજી.
gujarati.context: The Lord Bhagavan is pleased to reside in Sitapur, where one can enjoy happiness; the devoted soul, full of devotion and compassion, has reached the ultimate state of love for Purushottam (God).
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત છે ઇચ્છો બેચર<RHYME_206528>, ભજે હરિ છે પાટણે ઘર<RHYME_206528>; 
ભક્ત ગોકળી હરખો સુંદર<RHYME_206528>, ભજે હરિ રહે મુંજપર<RHYME_206528>.
gujarati.context: A true devotee is one who has renounced worldly desires and worships God with a pure heart, considering their home to be the divine abode. The devoted soul, Gokuli, is beautiful and worships God residing in the heart of the devotee.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત સોની ઇન્દરજી, પાલણપુરે રહે કુસંગ તજી; 
કણબી ભક્ત ગોવિંદજીભાઈ<RHYME_206513>, રહે તે ગઢ મંડાણા માંઇ.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devoted ones, Soni and Indrajee, are free from envy; they reside in Palanpur, where love prevails. Similarly, the devotee Gopinathbhai's heart resides at the sacred temple, unattached to worldly desires.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત કુબેર દવાડે, ભજ્યો હરિ ન પડ્યો પવાડે; 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત બેચર બળદેવ<RHYME_206545>, રહે ધિણોજ્યે ભજે વાસુદેવ<RHYME_206545>.
gujarati.context: A devotee's love is like Kubera's wealth, which cannot be exhausted; a true devotee's devotion remains unchanged even in adversity.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
નરસઇ ભક્ત ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>, મૂલચંદ એ જન ઉદાર<RHYME_206515>; 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત છે કશલીબાઈ<RHYME_206513>, એહાદિ જન મેસાણા માંઇ.
gujarati.context: A devoted soul is a true devotee, with a generous heart like the ocean. Such a selfless person's faith is truly divine and Godly in its nature.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત દ્વારકો જીવણ<RHYME_206546>, ભાટ ચતુરો રહે આંબાસણ<RHYME_206546>; 
ખેંગારજી મોડજી ડુંગરજી, ભગવાન દયાળે બીક વરજી.
gujarati.context:
A devoted devotee's soul is absorbed in Dwarka; their body remains calm and peaceful, like the forest of mango trees.

God has pardoned the sinner, releasing them from the cycle of karma.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ખરા ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત ભલભાઈ, વસે ગામ વિજાપરડા માંઇ; 
કણબી ભક્ત હીરો વેણીદાસ<RHYME_206508>, રૂડા ભક્ત સિતાપુર વાસ<RHYME_206508>.
gujarati.context: The devout and pious person resides in the land of devotion, free from worldly troubles. Those who are truly devoted live in Sita Pur or Rooda, a place of spiritual liberation.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભાવસાર મેઘો કેશવજી, રહે કાલરિયે કુસંગ તજી; 
લવજી પ્રાગજી નાથોભાઈ<RHYME_206513>, કહીએ કણબી ભક્ત નાથબાઈ<RHYME_206548>.
gujarati.context: The clouds of love and separation are fleeting, just like the waves on the Kalari river that recede with the tide. The devoted heart remains steadfast in its longing, seeking solace only from the beloved's words.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ ભક્તિ પ્રભુજીની કરે, રહી ગામ તે ઉદલપરે; 
જીવણ નાઇ હરખો સતવારો, કણબી ભક્ત રાયચંદ સારો.
gujarati.context: Devotion is done for the Lord, and in this village, there's no worry or fear; a devoted soul like Bhakta Raychand is always at peace.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ ભક્ત બાઈ ભાઈ<RHYME_206513>, વસે ગામ તે ખેરવા માંઇ; 
ભક્ત પ્રભુનો પુંજો પટેલ<RHYME_206549>, તેહ ગામ હેબવે વસેલ<RHYME_206549>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee's love for God is like a seed that grows in the village, nurturing and flourishing; it is said to be planted by Patel, symbolizing the Lord's power.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત દેવચંદ ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>, વસે ગામ ખરોડા મોઝાર<RHYME_206515>; 
શા હરખજી માતમ ભાટ<RHYME_206505>, ગામ દેવડે તજી ઉચ્ચાટ<RHYME_206505>.
gujarati.context: The devotee's love is as fleeting as a cloud, and their village home remains unchanged; just like the earth does not move with the rising of the sun.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત ભૂખણ મનછારામ<RHYME_206502>, તુલસી ભગો ભાવસાર નામ<RHYME_206502>; 
હરિજન એક જ્ઞાનબાઈ, એહાદિ જન રહે મેઉ માંઇ.
gujarati.context: The devotee is a hungry soul, satisfied by the name of the Lord, Tulsidas; one who has knowledge of the Self and remains detached in this world.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભગો જેતશી જીવો ચારણ<RHYME_206550>, એહ ભક્ત રહે દેવરાસણ<RHYME_206550>; 
કણબી ભક્ત કહીએ નરહર<RHYME_206528>, ભાવસાર પુંજો ને બેચર<RHYME_206528>.
gujarati.context: The divine is reached through devotion, and a true devotee resides in the realm of God. A devoted heart is blessed with spiritual wealth, leaving worldly attachments behind.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સાંકળા આદિ સતસંગી સઇ, વડા ભક્ત એ રહે વસઈ; 
રામજી ગણેશ ઝુમો નાગર<RHYME_206551>, બાઈ સોના ભક્ત ઉજાગર<RHYME_206551>.
gujarati.context: A person who is a true devotee and humble lives in the presence of God, free from desires. Their soul is illuminated by devotion to Ram, Ganesh, and others.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત માનસિંઘ કણબી કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, એહાદિ જન લાંગણોજ લહીએ<RHYME_206507>; 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત છે ઝૂમખરામ<RHYME_206502>, હરિજન ગંગા ગલાલ નામ<RHYME_206502>.
gujarati.context: A devout person's true nature is revealed in their actions, and a true devotee's soul is immersed in devotion like the Ganges River.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જીવો વસતો ને જ્ઞાનબાઈ, કણબી ભક્ત પલિયજ માંઇ; 
કોળી ભક્ત બાલ્યકદાસ કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, ક્ષત્રી કેશોજી ગોદડજી લહીએ<RHYME_206507>.
gujarati.context: Live with simplicity and wisdom, and let the devotee's love be your guide; just like a warrior's valor is his crowning glory, a true devotee's tears are their greatest blessing.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
મોકોજી ને કણબી ખુશાલ<RHYME_206519>, ગોવિંદ નાયક મિયાં લાલ<RHYME_206519>;

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: A great devotee is like a small spark that cannot be described; the noble devotee is in the fiery furnace of karma.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી માનોજી ઉમોજી કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, કણબી ગોકુલ તુલસી લહીએ<RHYME_206507>;

gujarati.context:
The couplet describes the devotion of a devotee who considers even the smallest acts as worship, just like Lord Krishna's flute plays sweet melodies on Tulsi leaves in Gokul.

God-realized souls are pure and radiant, understood by those who have realized their true nature through devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત મનોહર છે બ્રાહ્મણ<RHYME_206554>, કણબી કુબેર જેઠો હરિ શરણ<RHYME_206554>; 
રાયચંદ ક્ષત્રી આસકરણ<RHYME_206554>, એહાદિ ભક્ત રહે મોખાસણ<RHYME_206554>.
gujarati.context: A devout person is a Brahmin to the Lord, seeking refuge in God like Kubera's servant; A warrior-like devotee remains humble and dedicated in their worship of God.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ઝુલાસણ માંહિ રહે ચોધરી, કઠણ ભક્તિ પ્રભુજીની કરી; 
દ્વિજ ગુલાબચંદ સુખચંદ<RHYME_206555>, વલ્લભ રામ જીવરામ વૃંદ<RHYME_206555>.
gujarati.context: In the heart of the city, one finds devotion to God, and with pure intention, one's soul is filled with joy. The devotees, like Gulabchand and Sukhchand, are connected to Vallabh Ram, their eternal divine companion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન હરિકુંવર્યબાઈ, એહ જન નાર્દિપુર માંઇ; 
કણબી ભક્ત વેણીદાસ વળી, ભાવસંગ નરોત્તમ મળી.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a Harijan (low-caste) woman, comparing her to the divine Narad in his native city of Nardipur. Her devotion is likened to that of Veeneidas, a great devotee of God.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જતન રળિયાત વજી જન<RHYME_206509>, કર્યું કણબી કુળ પાવન<RHYME_206509>; 
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત પ્રતાપજી નામ<RHYME_206502>, ઉમેદજી અગ્રોજી અકામ<RHYME_206502>.
gujarati.context: A person's fate is predetermined, and their actions are merely a manifestation of their inherent nature. One's reputation and accomplishments are a reflection of their innate character, regardless of external circumstances.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
થાનોજી બનોજી હરિજન<RHYME_206509>, દલુજી અમરોજી પાવન<RHYME_206509>; 
શેઠ સાંકળચંદ મૂલચંદ<RHYME_206557>, હરિજીવન અવલનંદ<RHYME_206557>.
gujarati.context: The humble become great through God's grace, and the lowly are exalted on the next day. The weaver's thread is broken, but life's tapestry is still woven.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ ભક્ત બાઈ ભાઈ<RHYME_206513>, વસે ગામ ડાંગરવા માંઇ; 
હરિજન પુરુષોત્તમ હર્ખો, વાસણજી વિઠલજી નીર્ખો.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet in 1-2 lines:

This is the story of a devotee brother and sister, who live in a village where they take care of their family's land; They are virtuous people, like Harishchandra, Vasudevji, and Vitthalji.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હીરો જેકર્ણ ને દાનસંઘ, નાથા બેચર ને હરિરંગ; 
એહાદિ ભક્ત કણબી કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, રૂડા જન રાજપર લહીએ<RHYME_206507>.
gujarati.context: A hero's wealth is in his virtues, not a foolish person's in their riches; the wise devotee shares their wisdom with others, just like a king shares his kingdom.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: God resides in the hearts of devoted souls, despite being surrounded by worldly affairs; Lord Ganesha's color is a combination of red and white, symbolizing the beauty of devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: A devotee like me is fortunate to have Lord Narayan as a companion; Haribhakt Galla Bai, this village is blessed with her devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ગંગારામ ગણેશ ગોપાલ, માનો વાલો દલના દયાળ;

gujarati.context:
The summary is:

Ganga Ram Ganesh Gopal, a revered saintly figure with compassion; devotees worship Hari in his temple, their souls at peace.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત માધવજી નામે, ભજે હરિ રહે ઈરાણે ગામે;

gujarati.context:
Madhavji, a devout devotee, worships Hari at his home; his soul is filled with the beauty of devotion and he becomes one with the Divine.

His entire being is transformed into the essence of devotion, and he is nothing but the beautiful manifestation of the Lord.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહાદિ ભક્ત જન દયાળ<RHYME_206564>, ભજે હરિ રહે ગામ કુંડાળ<RHYME_206564>; 
સોની ભક્ત દયાળજી મંગલ<RHYME_206565>, કણબી ભાવસંગ છે અમલ<RHYME_206565>.
gujarati.context: The devotee of God is merciful and kind to the villagers; their love and devotion are pure and true, like the sweet sounds of a flute.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજભક્ત છે ઉમેદરામ<RHYME_206502>, બાઈ એક બેન કુંવર્ય નામ<RHYME_206502>; 
ભક્ત દેવચંદ ભાવસાર<RHYME_206515>, રહે ભક્ત એ કડી મોઝાર<RHYME_206515>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Ummedram's love is dual, both worldly and divine; his devotion remains steadfast like a mountain peak.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત દેવકર્ણ કહીએ<RHYME_206507>, સારો જન સેદરડે લહીએ<RHYME_206507>;

gujarati.context: A devoted servant of God says, "The pure soul is consumed by the divine fire." A true devotee of Lord Rama has abandoned worldly desires and settled in His abode.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત ભાવસાર ભુલોભાઈ<RHYME_206513>, અવલબા રાજપર માંઇ<RHYME_206567>; 
કણબી ભક્ત છે ગલાલબાઈ<RHYME_206566>, ભજે હરિ રહે ઊભડા માંઇ.
gujarati.context: A devotee's love is so deep that they forget everything else; their love for God remains unbroken even when faced with difficulties.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
રામજી ઘેલો કસલબાઈ, કણબી ભક્ત મનીપર માંઇ<RHYME_206567>;

gujarati.context: Ramaji's cleverness is compared to Kubera's wealth, implying that one's devotion is more valuable than material possessions. The couplet suggests that true devotion can't be bought or earned, but rather comes from a pure and selfless heart.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત છે શંકર નામ<RHYME_206502>, ભક્ત પ્રભુનો રહે ઘૂમે ગામ<RHYME_206502>;

gujarati.context: The devotee is named Shankar, and remains in God's abode, playing and dancing with joy. The lowly Harijan is blessed to have the pure-hearted Gokul as their guide.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

કહેતાં કહેતાં થાકે વાણી મન<RHYME_206509>, જેમ છે તેમ ન કહેવાય જન<RHYME_206509>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

One's birthplace is where one should stay and enjoy, don't go anywhere else; think only of your own home and don't forget to remember it as it is.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જેમ જલ અર્ણવથી, ઊપજે લહરી અપાર<RHYME_206515>;

gujarati.context: Just as the waves arise from the ocean's depth, so too do the devotees of God arise from His glory; similarly, just as a river flows endlessly without bounds, so too do the descendants of Hari-jan flow on forever.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
અખંડ અહોનિશ ઊપજે, તેનો નવ્ય થાય નિરધાર<RHYME_206571>;

gujarati.context: The impermanence of life arises suddenly, and its new chapter is predetermined; only the writer knows what has been written, what will be written, and what is being written this war.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 119: Danḍhāvya Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

The rich and the poor are equal in God's eyes, as souls; 
The great soul of God is revealed, with a humble heart's surrender.

transliteration.context: The essence of life lies in the absence of pain and the joy that comes from remembering one's name; while worldly desires may bring momentary pleasure, they also sow the seeds for great suffering.

transliteration.context: The devotee, Lal, was once an ordinary person, but with devotion to the Lord, he became extraordinary. Just like Punjo Bhat, who remained humble despite his great spiritual achievements.

The devotees are like sparks that fade away quickly, just as the Kalole river dries up in autumn; another devotee, Gangādās, and Narottam Vāsaṇajī have also gone.

transliteration.couplet:

A devotee named Kākujī has met with Kāshīdās and Shīdharadās; he is now a part of their world.

This devotee is truly blessed, for he has found his Lord and has transcended social boundaries.

The poet praises Keshavji and Rayaji, with Kaashidas's poetry being compared to the sacred river Ganges. Bhavani Shankar is considered a brother, akin to one who has control over Shri Zaver Dhamasaan.

Kaṇabī bhakta Rāmadās bhāī, Kuber Vasan Nānī bāī; <RHYME_14>
Kaṇabī bhakta kahīe Moṭībāī, bhakta Bhāṭ Ragho Bājībhāī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: A devotee (Kaṇabī) is like Ramadas, while a rich person is like Kuber Vasan Nānī; similarly, a singer is like Moṭībāī and a player is like Bhāṭ Ragho Bājībhāī.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij rūp raḷiyāt nām, Ṭhār Harakho Unāve gām; <RHYME_15>
Kṣhatrī bhakta Rāsojī Vakhato, bhajavā Hari karyo draḍh mato.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises the name "Dvij" as a sacred one, and longs for God to take care of their village. It also mentions Rasoji, a devotee who wholeheartedly serves God with unwavering faith.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan Galāl Sonār, dvij Dolī Rāī Bhāvasār; <RHYME_16>
Eh ādi bhakta bījā kaī, bhaje Prabhu Pethāpar raī.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: The humble and pure-hearted (Harijan) are the golden treasures of God, while the high-caste (Dvij) are bound by worldly attachments. The devotees who cultivate love for God will attain eternal bliss.

transliteration.couplet:
Ichchho Sakaro Kasalo vaḷī, eh ādi jan Jaṇasāli; <RHYME_17>
Bhakta ek chhe Mīṭho kumbhār, vase Vāsaṇ gām mozār.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks about the desire for divine love being a strong and sacred bond between the devotee and God. A devotee is compared to a potter who shapes his life like clay, surrendering fully to the Lord's will.

transliteration.couplet:
Amaje bhakta Mūlo Chodharī, bhajī Hari gayo bhav tarī; <RHYME_18>
Pagī Lālo Chhelo harijan, Shobhāsaṇāmā bhakta pāvan.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: A devotee's roots are severed from worldly attachments and they attain liberation through devotion to God; a true devotee is elevated to the highest state of spiritual awareness.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Kuber Khushāl, Chāndisaṇe e bhakta vishāl; <RHYME_19>
Kaṇabī Devajī rahe gām Soje, bhaje Prabhujīne sukh moje.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: A devoted servant is pleasing to God, and his devotion expands in the darkness of night. The devotee remains peaceful at home, serving the Lord with joy in his heart.

transliteration.couplet:

Bhakta sutār Bechar nām, harijan kahīe Gangārām.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: Ganesh, with a single glance, performs devotion to Lord Hari always; He is known as Bhakta Sutara, a devotee of the highest order.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Gaṇesh ne Bhago, telī Mūlachande melyo dago; <RHYME_22>
Dhano Dalodās chhe Chodharī, melī pāp bhajyā āpe Hari.  <RHYME_22>

transliteration.couplet:

Dvij Kushal Sonā Bhāvasār, eh bāiyo Māṇasā mozār.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: A Kshatriya is a lowly person, yet he has cleansed his soul; A twice-born Brahmin is lost in material desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Vīro Jīvaṇ Chodharī, Rāṭhoḍ Vaṇārashī bhaje Hari; <RHYME_24>
Kṣhatrī Ravojī Voro Miyājī, vase Varasoḍe kusang tajī.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: A devotee's life is like a precious jewel, offering worship to Lord Hari. A king's pride and glory are but fleeting moments, as they ultimately succumb to the darkness of time.

transliteration.couplet:
Haribhakta Kiko Bhāvsār, rahe Lākharoḍ gām mozār; <RHYME_25>

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

The devotee's love for God is like a flame that burns brightly, just as the Lakhrodi village fire never goes out; Similarly, a true devotee's love for Govindji (Krishna) is unwavering and constant.

transliteration.couplet:
Jaṇasāli Lakhā Dhanā, rahe Rāṇāsar bhakta Prabhunā; <RHYME_26>
Harijan Prāgajī luvār, bhakta rahe Singhapar mozār.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: A person's worth is measured by their wealth and relationships with powerful people. True devotion lies in being devoted to God, not seeking power or prestige.

transliteration.couplet:

Satavārā Prāgajī ne Jīvo, Revo Sānkaḷo ne bhakta Devo.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: Devotees like Dayalji are rare to find, as they understand the value of many lives being saved. Only a few like Pragaji have taken births, and only devotees like Bhaktadev receive God's mercy.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan Vajībāī ek, Jeṭhī Vakhat Vajī vaṇik; <RHYME_28>
Nandabāī Raḷiyātbāī, ehādi jan Vijāpar māi.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: One's true nature is revealed in the presence of a worthy friend, and love blossoms when two souls resonate together. This connection transcends social boundaries, revealing each other's true selves.

transliteration.couplet:

Kuber Tulasī ne Rāmajī, Jīvaṇ Narasai Shankar Shāmajī.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: A true devotee is like a beautiful gem, with pure devotion shining bright. The Lord, in turn, shines equally radiant on the devotee's soul.

transliteration.couplet:

Hemachand Rāmachand jan, Bhāvasār e bhakta pāvan.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: A fortunate person is a precious gem, and a true devotee has the power to purify even the smallest particle of dust. A great soul like Hemachand Rama Chand can purify even the entire universe through his devotion.

transliteration.couplet:

Āshārām Motī Bhāvasār, Shā Ambārām bhakta udār.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: A wakeful soul is a true devotee, just like a noble-minded person who enjoys divine play. One who has faith and devotion can experience the joy of spiritual pursuits.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Tārāchand Nandarām, Bhāvasār mānu Sānkali nām; <RHYME_32>

transliteration.context:
A devotee like Tārāchand Nandarām is rare; one who loves God's beauty like Sānkali is even more exceptional.
Among devotees, some are pure and others are powerful, with Jalobhāī being an example of the latter.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta dvij Hulās chhe ek, bhajī Hari tajī nahi ṭek; <RHYME_33>
Eh ādi harijan jeh, vase gām Geritāmā teh.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: A devotee is one who has devotion to God, not just verbal worship. This love-filled path leads to the village of God's abode, known as Geritāmā.

transliteration.couplet:

Dvij Dhanajī ne Rāmabāī, bhakta Prabhunā Pāmolya māi.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The devotee's love is like the seven seas and the seven mountains, overflowing in devotion to God. The soul of a devotee is surrendered to God, just like Ramanand Swami was surrendered to Lord Rama.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee like Bhakta Vanareshi Rayachand worships Lord Govind. He is a Harijan from a small village called Agalodya.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:
Ambārām Sonī Premachand, e Bāmaṇave bhaje Govind; <RHYME_37>

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Sonī Premachand worships Govind with devotion, and Koḷī's devotee Kubojī continues to sing God's praise by the sea.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Bhāṭ Sāyabojī jāṇo, gām Kaiparmā paramāṇo; <RHYME_38>
Vaḍnagare vase bahu jan, bhakta Prabhunā param pāvan.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: The devotee knows that God is present everywhere, from the smallest grain to the vast universe. Many people reside in the city of knowledge, but only the true devotees are elevated by the Lord's divine presence.

transliteration.couplet:

Becharādi dvij bhakta bhāī, harijan Jeṭhī Dolibāī.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The couplet refers to a devotee named Dvij Ujam who is a constant companion of Lord Sadashiv and another devotee named Becharaadi who is a humble servant of God.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The devotee's love is beyond measure and divine, like the river Bhavasar that never dries up. The author Hemachand and his friend Vaḍnagare are sleeping in their home in Gujarat.

transliteration.couplet:

Eh ādi bījā harijan, vase Shrīpore bhakta pāvan.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

The devotee's soul is connected to God's compassion and mercy; in this life, they are purified like a pilgrim visiting Shripora.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Amulakh and Dvijbhāī are the first two brothers, while Lakṣhmībāī is their sister; Shivabāī alone has taken a vow to meditate on God, separating herself from worldly attachments.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

Beautiful Satasangi Shilat was called Bechar by Jeetharam. Tribhovan and others like Amarchand and Hemchand worshipped God Govind.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:
Devabāī Nandabāī kahīe, gām Āiṭhormā e lahīe; <RHYME_48>

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee (bhakta) is filled with joy and happiness when they sing praises to God, feeling connected to Him.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee of Lord Narayana is one who has transcended the world's desires; Ganesha is pleased with those who take up noble endeavors.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The devotee's soul is absorbed in the divine, and their love for God is unwavering; this pure devotion brings them closer to the Supreme Being.

transliteration.context: Lord Bhagwanbhai is living happily in Sitapur with his mother; Devotee Bhavasar has great devotion to Purushottama.

transliteration.couplet:

Bhakta Gokaḷī Harakho sundar, bhaje Hari rahe Munjapar.  <RHYME_52>

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

A devotee's soul is always at peace like Dvarka, and their mind remains calm in every situation; God has compassion and bestows blessings abundantly.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: Sanikala and Satsangi Sai are devotees of God, living in Vasai; while Rajaji Ganesha Zumo Nagar is a devotee who has awoken to the truth in Sona's presence.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

A devotee like Moṭā Nānobhāī is hard to find; his spiritual stature is immense.

transliteration.context: In the village of Gokul, Tulsi's fame spread far and wide, while Purushottam Rabarari Ratano gained recognition among devotees.

transliteration.couplet:

After his royal duties, Manohar still maintains his devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Zulāsaṇ māhi rahe Chodharī, kaṭhaṇ bhakti Prabhujīnī karī; <RHYME_72>
Dvij Gulābchand Sukhchand, Vallabh Rām Jīvarām vṛund.  <RHYME_72>
transliteration.context: The devotee remains deeply absorbed in the Lord's love, with their heart filled with devotion and longing. The poet's soul is united with God's, in a state of sweet surrender.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan Harikuvaryabāī, eh jan Nārdipur māi; <RHYME_73>
Kaṇabī bhakta Veṇīdās vaḷī, Bhāvasang Narottam maḷī.  <RHYME_73>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises the beauty of Nardipur, a place where devotees like Veni Das and Narottam are filled with devotion. It celebrates the divine beauty of the place that inspires such love and devotion in its visitors.

transliteration.couplet:
Jatan raḷiyāt vajī jan, karyu kaṇabī kuḷ pāvan; <RHYME_74>
Kṣhatrī bhakta Pratāpjī nām, Umedjī Agrojī akām.  <RHYME_74>
transliteration.context: A devotee is one who faces hardships with determination and remains steadfast, their devotion being the source of their spiritual growth. The name "Pratāpjī" signifies a strong faith in God's will.

transliteration.couplet:
Thānojī Banojī harijan, Dalujī Amarojī pāvan; <RHYME_75>
Sheṭh Sānkaḷchand Mūlachand, Harijīvan avalanand.  <RHYME_75>
transliteration.context: The couplet compares two people, one who is noble and virtuous (Thānojī Banojī) and another who is worthless and wicked (Sheṭh Sānkaḷchand). The former's life is full of joy and bliss, while the latter's is filled with suffering and distress.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi bhakta bāī bhāī, vase gām Ḍāngaravā māi; <RHYME_76>
Harijan Puruṣhottam Harkho, Vāsaṇajī Viṭhalajī nīrkho.  <RHYME_76>
transliteration.context: A devotee is born in the village of Dangarva, and by the name Harijan Purushottam Harkho; by the age-old tradition, I am Vasajan Vitthalaji.

transliteration.couplet:
Hīro Jekarṇa ne Dānasangh, Nāthā Bechar ne Harirang; <RHYME_77>
Ehādi bhakta kaṇabī kahīe, rūḍā jan Rājapar lahīe.  <RHYME_77>
transliteration.context: A devotee's eyes are filled with God's love and the king of heaven; a mere mortal's eye is only for worldly gain.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Nārāyaṇ vasatā, gām Rājapare jan chhatā; <RHYME_78>
Bhago Gaṇesh kaṇabī varṇa, Rūpo Sutār rahe Nandāsaṇ.  <RHYME_78>
transliteration.context: Lord Krishna resides in the hearts of His devotees and rules over Gokula village. The color of devotion is divine, and Rupa's form remains in joy with Nanda's family.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Morār Joyato, jan Nārāyaṇ ne Vasato; <RHYME_79>
Haribhakta chhe Galālbāī, eh gām Māthāsul māi.  <RHYME_79>
transliteration.context: A devotee like Morarji is blessed by God Naryan, and he resides in the city; a devotee like Haribhakta is loved by God and is at peace in his own home.

transliteration.couplet:
Gangārām Gaṇesh Gopāl, Māno Vālo dalanā dayāḷ; <RHYME_80>
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe bhakti vālī, bhaje Hari gām rahe Ṭunḍālī.  <RHYME_80>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee's love for God (Hari) is like a flame that burns bright and unending, reaching the heavens (Ṭunḍālī).

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Mādhavajī nāme, bhaje Hari rahe Īrāṇe gāme; <RHYME_81>
Kaṇabī bhakta Kalo Punjobhāī, bhakta Kevaḷ ne Rūpābāī.  <RHYME_81>
transliteration.context: Two devotees, Mādhavajī and Kaṇabī, sing the praises of God Hari in rural Īrāṇe village. Another devotee, Kalo Punjobhāī, has his beloved Rūpābāī as his devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi bhakta jan dayāḷ, bhaje Hari rahe gām Kunḍāḷ; <RHYME_82>
Sonī bhakta Dayāḷajī mangal, kaṇabī Bhāvasang chhe amal.  <RHYME_82>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee's compassion takes them to God, and they happily go back home; this is the good omen for the devotees. Their mind is pure and filled with divine love.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvijabhakta chhe Umedarām, bāī ek ben Kuvarya nām; <RHYME_83>
Bhakta Devachand Bhāvasār, rahe bhakta e Kaḍī mozār.  <RHYME_83>
transliteration.context: A devotee is like a treasure trove of virtues, with one virtue being the name Kuvarya; The devotee's heart remains pure and unaffected by worldly desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Devakarṇa kahīe, sāro jan Sedaraḍe lahīe; <RHYME_84>
Dvij haribhakta Harirām, rūḍo jan Jākasaṇe gām.  <RHYME_84>
transliteration.context: A devotee's words are pleasing to God, and a seeker's heart is filled with bliss when they speak the truth. A noble soul like Hariram, devoted to Lord Krishna, goes to his eternal home (Jākasaṇe) in a happy state.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Bhāvasār Bhulobhāī, Avalabā Rājapar māi; <RHYME_85>
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Galālbāī, bhaje Hari rahe Ūbhaḍā māi.  <RHYME_85>
transliteration.context: The devotee is completely absorbed in devotion and forgets the material world, gaining access to the Lord's grace. The devotee's soul is filled with joy and they sing praises of God, their heart overflowing with love.

transliteration.couplet:
Rāmajī ghelo Kasalbāī, kaṇabī bhakta Manīpar māi; <RHYME_86>
Kaṇabī Kuber Lakṣhamīdās, bāī Nāthī bhaje Avināsh.  <RHYME_86>
transliteration.context: A devotee of Rama is considered a Kasalbhai, and the Lord is pleased with such a devoted soul. This couplet also refers to Kuber Lakshmidas and Nathi Bhajji Avinash, emphasizing devotion as the ultimate goal.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta chhe Shankar nām, bhakta Prabhuno rahe Ghūme gām; <RHYME_87>
Harijan kaṇabī Morār, sāro bhakta Gokaḷ luvār.  <RHYME_87>
transliteration.context: The devotee is dear to Lord Shankar, and the devotee remains in the heart of God; Harijan's love for God is like a bee that never departs from the lotus flower.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi jan rahe Godhāviye, kahyā deshmā lesh lāviye; <RHYME_88>
Kahetā kahetā thāke vāṇī man, jem chhe tem na kahevāy jan.  <RHYME_88>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one's true self (jan) is hidden within oneself, and it's not about where you come from or what others say. It emphasizes the importance of knowing thyself rather than seeking external validation.

transliteration.couplet:
Jem jal arṇavathī, ūpaje laharī apār; <RHYME_89>
Tem Hari mahājaḷathī, harijan aparampār.  <RHYME_89>
transliteration.context: The world is an endless ocean of love and devotion, just as the waves of the sea are infinite and unstoppable. Similarly, Lord Hari is a boundless sea of compassion and kindness, beyond human understanding.

transliteration.couplet:
Akhanḍ ahonish ūpaje, teno navya thāy niradhār; <RHYME_90>
Koṇe lakhyā koṇ lakhashe, koṇ lakhe chhe ā vār.  <RHYME_90>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should not be overly attached to material possessions, as they can be taken away at any moment. It advises us to let go of what we have and not get too hung up on acquiring more.
